## Greeting a professor based on the time of day

```{r}
#| label: package-loading

library(stringr)
```

```{r}
#| label: time-manipulation
 
# take a precise time and return a general time of day (morning, afternoon, evening, night)

specific_to_general <- function(time){
    if (time >= 6 && time < 12){ #if it's between 6 and 12
      return("morning") #return morning
    } else if (time >= 12 && time < 18){ #if it's between 12 and 18
      return("afternoon") #return afternoon
    } else if (time >= 18 && time < 24){ #if it's between 18 and 24
      return("evening") #return evening
    } else { #if it's between 0 and 6
      return("night") #return night
    }
  }

```

```{r}
#| label: name-manipulation

# take a name and return it in proper case

name_manipulation <- function(name){
  name_lowercase <- str_to_lower(str_sub(name, 2)) #get the lowercase part of the name
  name_uppercase <- str_to_upper(str_sub(name, 1, 1)) #get the uppercase part of the name
  name_proper <- paste0(name_uppercase, name_lowercase) #combine the two parts
  return(name_proper) #return the proper case name
}
```

```{r}
#| label: greeting

# take a name and a time, and return a greeting

greet_professor <- function(name, time){
  general_time <- specific_to_general(time) #get the general time
  name_proper <- name_manipulation(name) #get the proper case name
  paste0("Good ", general_time, ", Professor ", name_proper, "!")
}

# test the function
greet_professor("nAtalie", 17)
```

```{r}
#| label: greeting-multiple-professor

# use a loop to greet a lot of professors

professors <- c("nAtalie", "mIchael", "sArAh", "jOhn", "eMily", "dAniel", "rAchel", "jAmes", "lAuren", "bRian")
for (professor in professors){
  print(greet_professor(professor, 18))
}
```
